alert.note: Alert for Brown; Callahan; Coleman (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 04 at 6:21PM CDT until May 04 at 6:45PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN CALLAHAN...NORTHWESTERN BROWN AND NORTHEASTERN COLEMAN COUNTIES... At 620 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Echo, or near Burkett, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe storm will be near... Burkett around 635 PM CDT. Grosvenor around 640 PM CDT. Cross Cut around 645 PM CDT. Byrds around 650 PM CDT. May around 700 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Us- 283 Near The Coleman-Callahan County Line, Echo and Owens. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
